author: A C.

description: Why do people like this place? The sashimi wasn't that fresh or well cut when we were last here. Too bad because I like the intimate feel of the place.
author: Tina Z.

description:
Domo doesn't take reservations and I'm not a fan of waiting in line, but my hosts recommended it, so I built up some patience and signed up on the list. And I am so glad I did; this food, it is definitely worth the wait!

Based on the Yelp recommendations, I had pre-decided I would go for the fish taco and crudo made of Sea Urchin and Tuna. In addition I had the Kobe beef and a "Daddy roll. I honestly wouldn't be able to choose a favourite of the four dishes. They all were so delicious and full of flavours. I was almost hoping that it wouldn't be enough food, so that I could choose another tempting dish from the menu, but "unfortunately" it was more than enought food. The dry sake recommended by the waiter, was a good match. 

The place seats approx. 16-17 people inside, and has three tables outside. I arrived at about 8:20pm on a Sunday night, and had to wait 25-30 minutes with two couples in line before me. More guests arrived after me, so there is no doubt Domo could fill up a larger restaurant if they wanted. 

My compliments to the Chefs and the kitchen team, I'm willing to wait in line the next time I am back in the city.
author: Hildegunn N.

description:
A quaint little sushi bar in a nice neighbourhood with a lot of food options, this definitely stands out as a good option for sushi in the core is SF. 
It's a really small place and they do not take reservations, so go early if you can. If not be prepared to wait, but it will be worth it!

The selection of fish is a little limited but the quality stands out. Each and every bite bursts with flavour and is how sushi should be enjoyed! 

Service is decent although it is hard with low staff to customer ratio. They do try their best to get to you although you will have to call for their attention now and then. 

Prices seem fair for the quality you are getting but this is not a great bang for your buck place as it is on the pricier side of things.
author: Derwei C.

description: Domo came highly recommended by my sister + brother in law who came here often when they lived in SF. Does not disappoint, despite their great hype up (that's saying a lot). Will be back many many times in the future. Didn't see anything on the menu or specials board that I'm not eager to try. Winged it for my first order, with recommendations from staff, everything was amazing. Truly delicious.
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Fresh sushi & great experience! 

This restaurant is small and has bar seating only, so late afternoon or early evening is best of you want to be seated quickly.
author: Hilary M.

description:
A small sushi place with amazing quality fish. I went here with my mother (both obsessed with sushi and are pretty picky when it comes to sushi in SF vs. LA) and we were very impressed by the toro and toro belly. The quality of the fish was superb-melt in your mouth type nigiri.

As for the other dishes, they were one of a kind. I can confidently say that the roll I tried (it was a special and had tempura peppers but I can't remember the name) was unlike anything I've tasted before.

Not to mention that the $ was pretty reasonable considering the quality of fish!
author: Mia B.

description: Tiny little restaurant with great food! There's usually a wait because of how small the restaurant is, but I've never minded. The seating is mostly bar seating so don't expect a table. Food has always come out fast and the fish is so tasty! I live around the corner so I frequently order pick up which I would highly recommend if you just want some good sushi fast. Love this place!
author: Jessica F.

description:
This is our fave sushi spot in Hayes Valley.  It's a small hole-in-a-wall that's popular with the locals so it gets full quickly.

They don't have a large selection, but their menu is pretty diverse.  The sashimi and nigiri are always fresh and light, with a melt-in-your-mouth consistency.  Also try their appetizers and crudos -- which include both conventional and innovative selections.  

Recommended:
"Chef's seasonal choice" sashimi
Fish Tacos!!!  (this is one of their popular dishes for very good reason!)
Uni and Scallop crudos
Hamachi Carpaccio
Spicy Hulk roll
author: Dawne L.

description:
I'm so glad that my friend suggested this sushi spot! You're up close and personal with the chef, since the space is literally no bigger than the bar.  We arrived around 6:00pm and there were two spaces open. By the time we left there was a line out the door. So either run fast to get a spot early, or bring a coat to wait outside. The wait is deservedly so since the sushi screams fresh!

I ordered a crudo.. what's that you said? What is a crudo? Oh I'm so glad you asked - I had to ask too. It's a small bite of seafood served in one of those little soup ladles. Mine was the Scallop crudo. Delicious! Each piece of nigiri was flavorful and fresh and the signature Domo roll was very filling. Instead of having the usual hot sake, I paired my meal with their cold sake (which I can not recall the name). I was hesitant at first but the first sip reminded me of a citrus juice. Not sure if that is the flavor cold sake should have, but I really enjoyed it.

The atmosphere here is pretty chill - I am a big fan of intimate sushi settings where you can chat with the chef. Usually if you go often enough you'll start to receive the special treatment. I'd like that.
author: Jaylena P.

description: The sushi at this place is insanely good! Seating is limited.... When I say limited I mean they can seat about 15 people max.  It's definitely a hole in the wall type of place.... So no groups but a wonderful super intimate date spot.
author: Sugardumplin Z.

description:
The service here was really nice. Great waitstaff that were attentive when we needed them and left us to our dinner otherwise. Didn't seem to have an issue with us ordering a couple rounds of sushi. 

Rolls are a little on the creamy side for me personally. Lots of sauces and scallops and things. They have a short list of "plain" rolls as well, but not as deep of a list as their "specialty" rolls. Maybe would order more nigiri next time. Had the seared tuna as an appetizer though that was really well executed and the quality of fish was excellent. I wouldn't order the firecracker balls again though. Not really what I expecting, but they could be fun if that's what you're into. Look at the pictures here of them before you order. 

Had a very nice bottle of sake with our meal. Being so close to True Sake though (only a block away), I would expect none the less from a place serving it. 

Small place which will fill up fast. We came early (around 6pm) and on Monday though, so had no issue getting a seat.
author: Brian B.

description:
Came here for the first time the other night and they made a horrible first impression. The host asked if I minded waiting to be seated till my whole party got there. I was waiting for only one person and the place was empty so I said, actually I'd love to be seated so I can have a drink. He then pointed to two seats in the corner in front of the windy doorway and says, you can sit there and have a drink. Lol! I said, seriously?? The restaurant is EMPTY and you're telling  a lady who just politely asked to be seated for a drink to go hang out in the doorway... 

To boot, the sushi does not taste fresh.
author: F S.

description: Always worth the wait. Plus I think it's one of the only places in the city with Asahi Black, the best beer of all time.
author: Beth M.

description:
Came here after watching the Nutcracker and wanted sushi that was open late. Right when we walked up to Domo we noticed it was pretty small but packed and very lively. The ambiance was dark and tightly packed, and even though we walked in the same time a few other people did, we were all seated fairly quickly. 

We ordered the Hamachi Carpaccio to start off with and then moved on to Fatty Tuna Nigiri, a DEFINITE must if you enjoy a succulent, moist, and melt in your mouth piece of fresh fish, ugh SO expensive yet SO good. We also ordered the Domo Roll (baked), I think it was called the Saba Hit? Roll and a lemon and salmon roll. 

The carpaccio was pretty good, lightly seared and pretty juicy. Don't even get me started on the Fatty Tuna again, we all know how much I recommend it. Domo Roll was fantastic if you love your baked rolls. I could've done without the salmon and lemon rolls only because there was basically only lemon in the end pieces and it was pretty flavorless. The Saba roll was pretty good if you like Hamachi. We also got a couple Soporos for $5 (Small size). 

Service was good and the food came out pretty quickly. All in all Domo was a pretty great sushi place and open fairly late. I would come back again.
author: Christine C.

description: If you are looking for the quintessential neighborhood sushi bar you have arrived. Look no further. Seating is tight so getting there early helps. Sitting at a bar looking out onto the street reminds me of being in Europe. Everything is fresh, reasonable, and wait staff helpful and welcoming. And those firecracker balls.....
author: John G.

description: I didnt even have a chance to taste the food. EXTREMELY rude treatment by the waiter. I grabbed a chair to join my 2 friends at the Window Bar against the far end corner. A waiter comes there 2 seconds later without greeting and asks me in a loud very annoyed voice, "did you ask permission to take that chair", you CANNOT be there, I just CANNOT work like this, you CANNOT just come in here and grab a chair and sit here, I have no place to do my job, can you please RIGhT NOW take the chair back, like RIGHT now... so he goes on with his rant and I am just shocked and embarrassed of the scene he has caused whereas all I would've expected was him to tell me nicely that it wasn't ideal that I would sit there and that he could try to reaccomodate us to a better spot for 3 people when there became space available.
author: Auri B.

description: A wonderful little sushi place tucked away in the picturesque portion of Hayes Valley.  I met a friend for sushi on Friday after work at 6pm and luckily since it was just the two of us we were able to easily grab seats at the bar. The restaurant is small with only a few tables but turnover seemed pretty quick.  The sushi here is fresh and the combinations are delightful.   The Domo roll was by far my favorite-packed with tons of raw fish and jalapeño slices.  The salmon citron was refreshing with just the right amount of lemon to complement the salmon.  When we left at 7:45 there was a line out the door so I suggest coming early!
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: If you are gluten sensitive or celiac don't eat their rolls. They said it was real crab in the California roll however can I tell you it's not 100% real and they mix in the fake wheat based crab with it. I haven't been glutened this bad in a while. All I had was 4 of the Cali rolls so I know that it was the culprit.
author: Jesse M.

description:
Good sushi spot to check out if you're looking for a decent late night meal in Hayes (that's not BK). 

Pros:
+Cute and intimate setting with a pretty extensive menu
+Extremely fast service - we were in and out in 40 minutes even with a full restaurant 
+Good prices for Hayes 
+Open past 10 usually given how busy they are - whoooo no more wandering late at night wondering what to eat besides Grove

Cons:
-Limited veggie options (had the standard avo-veggie) 
-No miso soup for vegetarians :( 

Will be back!
author: Anu P.

description:
I was a little skeptical because this place looked really trendy and new age and some of the things on the menu were a little strange ... but overall I liked it.

To set the record straight, you don't come here for sushi. You don't even come here to rolls really, you come here for their specialty and interesting fusion dishes that include good fresh fish. 

But it doesn't mean that it isn't a yummy great time. They have good prices on drinks & sake, and some delicious specialty dishes like ... sushi-ish tacos and various fish marinates that are pretty tasty. This whole place is sort of dark, intimate, small, and really really warm most nights so great for intimate date nights! Charming indeed.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Upscale whole-in-the-wall with intimate vibe and the opprtunity to sit right in front of the chefs at the sushi bar.

Hamachi kama and red dragon roll on the specials menu are money.  

Not a bad wait on weekdays despite the small space.
author: Arzan R.

description:
4.5 Stars

Don't expect to come here with a large group.  Due to its size, I would say this is more of a place to spend some QT with a loved one or catch up with a friend.

The food is pretty gosh darn delicious.  I was a bit disappointed that they did not have the uni crudo but the scallop & salmon crudo pretty much made up for it.  The Fire Cracker Balls had a good combination of crunchy, creamy & spicy. I loved the Spicy Hulk, which is spicy tuna wrapped in cucumber instead of rice.

I would definitely go back.  Especially to try that uni crudo...
author: Rose A.

description:
Could be weird a Japanese restaurant mainly staffed with Hispanic people but after the first bite of one of their rolls you just forget that.

Then you start feeling the inspiration and the twists in flavors! Just perfect!

The place is small but very nice and calm! Yes calm as it's complicated for big parties to sit there.

The staff is so nice and helpful and not full of bullshit :-) if they don't have the answer to your question they will ask and come back with the answer.

Long story shorts: GO THERE
author: Guillaume B.

description:
Fish was chewy. Need I say more? I forced myself to eat the tuna and yellow tail sashimi before opting to stick with apps.

If you're looking to grab sake and some very American rolls, then this will do the trick. If you want decent sushi, go to O-Toro around the corner. And if you're considering waiting for 45 mins+ for a table, look elsewhere. I promise you'll be grateful that you read this review :)
author: Alyssa Y.

description: It was great at the moment, sitting on the high chairs with barely any space to move. It took us about 20minutes to get settled because the space was so small. Also, it was FANTASTIC that I got food poisoning after eating the smallest roll I have ever seen in my life. Overall, A+ experience.
author: Vivian K.

description:
The sushi was absolutely amazing. However the service was terrible. The host/server let three parties go ahead of us in line. They seemed to be friends of his. 

The food and sake was extremely slow to come out and the server was unfriendly.
author: Stephanie L.

description: For me, Domo is an unsung hero in the SF sushi scene. It's a place I've been coming back to for years for its simplicity, fresh fish and chill vibe. I don't fret about the wait - it's never as long as they say. And really, isn't fantastic sushi worth waiting for? I love the incredible selection; I often get pieces of sashimi here that are hard to find: versions of seabream, mackerel, bass and snapper. And you know if he has it - it's the best or he wouldn't purchase it.
author: Meredith R.

description: This isn't my go-to spot for sushi as the quality of the fish isn't the best since there are so many great spots in the city. The appetizers are really good though, especially the tacos! I come specifically for that appetizer every time.
author: Roberta V.

description:
Amazing , down to earth, authentic Japanese spot.
If you do not mind to wait a bit- they will call if you wonder in the charming neighborhood .
Excellent service and beautiful presentation  .
Loved it and will definitely be coming back! A hidden gem !
author: A B.

description:
My friends and I were really excited to try this place, but unfortunately, we never even got sat :( 

We came in at 7:30 last Friday (11/19) and were quoted an hour wait for 3 people; totally understandable! We came back around 8:30 and waited around until 9pm. When I asked the hostess for an update she said she "had no idea when we'd be seated".  We waited for another 20 minutes and were very poorly treated by the hostess and one of the servers. The server was also being rude to another group of customers that were waiting. All in all, we ended up leaving after waiting for two hours. I used to work in a restaurant, so I understand how stressful it can be, but the customer service was so disappointing.

I will be back because I've heard great things about this place, but hopefully there will be different employees working!!
author: Kalen B.

description:
Domo is that special place that could easily be missed or mistaken after 4 steps of passing by.  The sign is brightly lit but small in size keeping this place a secret little gem in Hayes Valley.  The prices are very reasonable and the food it outstandingly delicious. 

The seating is a bit sparse and the wait can get a tad long but it's well worth the wait.  Surprisingly the ambiance was subdued but it was nice.  Notorius B.I.G. was playing in the background while every diner kept there conversations on a light note.  It was shockingly at the appropriate noise level for such a small place and so many people.

I shared the Edamame ($4), Miso Soup ($3/each), and Seaweed Salad ($5) to start.  Followed up with a nice unfiltered Sake to wash down the meal.  The bottle was only $10 and gave us plenty of fluid to stay at that perfect level of intoxication.  Well, for me at least.  We ended up getting the "Fire Cracker Balls" roll and let me tell you - unbelievable!  I had no clue what I was looking at and once I took the brave step of putting it in my mouth for consumption I was thrilled beyond belief.  There could not have been enough of these on the plate or in my stomach.  The Spider roll and Negi-Hama roll were both pleasant and not too huge.  Spider roll ends are a bit tough to swallow on one bite but this sushi was made well and didn't fall apart after numerous bites.  The rice was used appropriately without overpowering the fish and ingredients inside.

I was superbly happy with our dining choice for sushi and will be going back most definitely.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I want in on a whim after getting a massage across the street at EarthBody Day Spa. How lovely to treat myself so well! 

I ordered:
Kampachi Kama Yaki - delicious  & tender, cooked perfectly.
Live Scallop - clean taste, thicker slices than I expected
Chu Toro - great creamy texture, not as full flavored as I expected
Shima Aji - this is a mild version of an aji, lovely
Spicy Tuna Handrail - generous portion, saratcha based spice 
Karatamba Sake  - dry sake, just as expected!

I sat at the bar facing out to the street. Service was good. I will come back another time I'm sure!
author: Jessica R.

description: Great "little"spot in Hayes Valley. Seats about 16 - 19 people and always had a wait. You put your name on the waiting list with a phone number and they call you. Have eaten a number of different rolls and nigiri there... TIP: What I like to do is put my name on the list for Domo and walk around the corner to Noir Lounge too have a drink.
author: Joy L.

description:
High quality and tasty sushi off the main Hayes Valley strip
Place is small but worth it
author: G K.

description:
We were 2nd on the list, 2 people, and waited 45m on a Friday night for service. 

Ordered fish taco appetizer. It was good, and the highlight of the night, but it arrived after our sushi. Note to staff: appetizers are meant to arrive before the main course. 

Ordered a variety of nigiri and 1 spicy tuna roll. Spicy tuna was average. All of the fish was completely tasteless. I couldn't differentiate the scallop from the mackerel. Seriously. 

Server never checked in on us after being served. 

Not sure why so many good ratings. Fish is supposed to have flavor, and the flavor shouldn't come from soaking it in soy sauce and wasabi.
author: Matt S.

description: Excellent rolls, not so expensive and really original. I definitely will come back ! I took dragon and salmon citron
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description: Love this little gem in Hayes and despite its limited space you don't feel too crammed in there. Been here a couple times now and everything is really fresh. Their Domo roll is delicious and is a variation on a baked California roll with Salmon added, melts in your mouth. Tuna fat, yellowtail and everything we have had is delicious. Definitely will be back to try more items.
author: Phillip H.

description:
Place is small and they don't take reservations so either come right when they open or be prepared to wait. 

I was drawn to this place because the pictures of the crudo and fish tacos looked so good!  They were indeed tasty and really enjoyed the creative approach to the tempura shell of a fish taco but at the end of the day.. The overall meal didn't knock my socks off. 

We had an assortment of nigiri and the daddy something roll. The fish variety is not that expansive and you can find better quality and cuts of fish elsewhere for cheaper.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Decided to give this place another shot. Happy we did! 

This time we arrived early put our name on the list. Went for drinks close by, took our time went back and got right in with no wait.

It's a small space, a bit pricey but Domo roll is great. Happy staff make Happy customers!
author: James R.

description: Amazing service! This restaurant is run and operated by quality, customer-first folks. Highly recommended!
author: Christian E.

description: Great sushi place! Pretty small so there is usually some wait. The crunchy California roll and Temptation were my favorite.
author: Coralie S.

description:
Why? = my boyfriend and I LOVE sushi, we recently moved to SF, needed to find a great sushi spot to call home! In Philly we went to the same place pretty much every Friday (the hostess and owner knew our order), after a full day of walking those mean hills we needed food asap, we actually ventured over to Sushi Zone, but got there right when the doors opened and there were people in front of us, so we had to wait an hour to be seated, went to Domo instead = GREAT IDEA!!
People/Vibe = polite, knowledgeable servers, friendly guests (almost got another couple's phone number :))
Food = Amazing.
Try = Fish tacos, Red Dragon roll, the Hulk, Seaweed salad
author: Lena M.

description:
Was really excited to try this sushi spot but was just disappointed with the service. The hostess didn't seem to be welcoming and did NOT want to be helpful. Noticed that a lot of the people at the restaurant were regulars or friends of staff which is great but this shouldn't stop them from being attentive to other guests.

We thankfully got seated and we ordered our food during last call.

Seaweed salad - pretty standard but delicious 
Fire tuna balls - it was okay, very "fusion"
Hamachi Carpaccio - really enjoyed the texture and flavor combination (would get this again if I were to go back)
Fish Tacos - never had anything like this and was very exciting to try (must have)
Salmon Sashimi - fresh and came in a rose shape (cute)
Spicy Tuna Roll - had sprouts in it which is different for us
Chu Toro Nigiri - they only had one serving of Toro left so we had to get a Chu Toro and it actually suited my tastes more
Toro Nigiri - melted in my mouth, very good

The food was definitely was 4 stars but service really dropped it down for me.
author: Michelle Joo H.

description:
Apparently San Franciscans are used to tourists. A guy on a bus pegged us as out-of-towners before we even saw him, and helpfully guided us to our destination on our first day in town. I'm guessing not many tourists find this place, a little sushi restaurant well away from most of the attractions. A Friend of DLW who now lives in the area met us here for lunch during our stay.

As the two of them caught up we had a nice sushi lunch. DLW can't resist chirashi  when it presents itself, and she was quite happy with the one here. I had a nigiri assortment with spicy tuna roll, just enough for lunch. We split a very cute bottle of Iichiko sake as well.

It's a cute space with counters along the walls, no tables, and only about 25 seats. The sushi chef and waitress were perfectly happy to chat with us while we sat in front of the bar waiting for our orders. I wish we could have tried some of the more creative choices on the menu. Maybe next time.
author: Mark A.

description:
There are a few really good sushi options in Hayes Valley so it's hard to choose just one! But although I like both The One and O-Toro, Domo has the best Rock n'Roll of the lot! This is my go-to sushi roll and Domo did it to absolute perfection. 

Be warned that the restaurant is super tiny so it's not easy to get a table. If you write your phone number on the waiting list though, you can go somewhere else in the neighborhood for a drink and they'll call when a table is ready. 

Well worth a try!
author: Lindsey B.

description: Was fine, location and atmosphere are cool, specialty rolls are interesting and work well.  One somewhat notable complaint-- the uni.  I guess it should be a red flag when uni is not market price.. but some may see it as the opposite.  $9 uni nigiri, I believe.  Was kinda black in color and legitimately tasted poisonous-- have never not finished every morsel of uni when I order it, but was not edible and really disappointing.  Very possible just a bad batch as it would not remain on the menu if that was the typical quality.  Would return to Domo
author: Chris M.

description:
Came here quite a while ago with babe to get our sushi grub on.

Babe and I got a couple of rolls and some crudos and a beer. If I recall correctly, we got the salmon and scallop crudo, very yum with lots of flavor. And the kobe beef, sexy mama, domo roll and one other roll that slips my mind.

The portions here are pretty small, so not for you if you love sushi and can't get enough. The crudos are very delicious though, I certainly recommend it.

Our server was eh, seemed bored, didn't talk much and didn't smile.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I'm rating this 5 stars because I've gone enough times to know the wait is worth it. 

It's a TINY place so it's not good for groups and esp for dinner there will be a wait -- write your name + number, walk to Suppenkuche and grab a drink until the hostess calls when your table is ready, typical wait time is 45-1hr. It has a rustic intimate vibe so it's a great spot for dates, the plus side is they're almost always on point with the music; think Toro Y Moi, Portishead, Modjo, etc.

We've tried almost everything on the menu, the price range is expected for the area. They have specials written on the mirror, look for it and try at least one nigiri or appetizer. Also try the spicy tuna crudo (get 2 orders), hamachi carpaccio, and fire cracker balls.
author: Av A.

description:
This place is super cozy, but that makes it super small. There's very limited seating and a wait for 2 even before 6pm on a Saturday.

I tried the crudo spoons. Its $7 for a choice of 2, between a scallop, salmon, spicy tuna, uni and ankimo crudo. I tried the uni and the ankimo, both of which were delicious, but not comparable to the spoonfull of happiness at koo sushi.

We also tried the salmon citron, 5 roll wrapped salon slices. It was ok, presentation was soso.

And the fireball... was not good. The portion is super small. It's super fried, and basically tastes like fries rice balls. In fact, when I bit it open, I could barely see any traces of the spicy tuna. 

Cute space, but not good enough for a return visit.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
Domo is something different than what I normally eat.  My friends and I chose this place because another sushi place was too packed so I didn't read the full details before coming here.  The place was really small and cute.  My friends and I were the first group there for dinner.

We ordered the following:

Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke--pretty good but nothing too special.  They just mixed tuna and wakame and topped it with tako.

Crudos--Salmon & Scallops.  They were both delicious. It's probably my favorite dish ordered.  They are in spoons and it's like drinking a shooter.

Sake Nigiri--nothing too special. It was a lot smaller than I expected but still good.

Rock & Roll--unagi and avocado roll.  The ratio of avocado to unagi was 2:1. I like avocado though so thought the roll was good.

Fire Cracker Balls--These came out very small.  It just tasted like deep fried rice balls topped with their sauces.

Spicy Hulk--tuna inside a cucumber wrap. Good but probably wouldn't order it again.

The owner was very nice to us and constantly checked up on us.  This place can be pricey if you're looking to leave full.  I had to order more food because I was not full and no where near satisfied.

I would recommend this place as a place to try at least once.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Super fresh sushi. We had the specials of bluefin and albacore nigiri which were both amazing. The hulk rolls were the highlight though - good spicy kick to it. 
The seaweed salad and miso soup were also standard great starters. 
The squid Ika nigiri was also impressively fresh. 
Only down side is to how small the place is but cosy for a bite for 2 worked for us :)
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
Good sushi at a fair price.  The uni was some of the freshest I have had in a while and the walu sashimi was served in meaty slices.  Very fresh with lots of flavor.  There is a wide variety of specialty rolls and a few of the basic.  Quite frankly the hamachi jalapeno roll was simple but one of the best.  At only $6 there was a good amount of fish in the role and just enough jalapeno to compliment the fish.  

The only downside is the long waits for the tables and the horrible hostess with all kinds of attitude.  You might be able to get away with being so nasty, but there is no reason to be.  The other minor annoyance is the writing of the specials on a mirror.  

Probably a good concept, but functionally a terrible idea.  Very difficult to see what is written on it because of the reflection.  

Just get a chalk board.  the place is small enough for everyone to see.
author: Scott C.

description: Unfortunately, I have to give this place 2.5 stars because of the quality of their fish. I have never bitten into a piece of nigiri or sashimi and had to chew through an unbreakable piece of muscle ? fiber. This unfortunate event happened in 2 of the 3 pieces of nigiri I had there- most quality sushi joints will have trimmed out the less desirable parts of the fish filets. It's the equivalent of biting into a piece of steak and getting your teeth stuck on a particularly stubborn chunk of gristle or tendon that you can't chew through and have to spit out. That aside, the sashimi salad was okay, the spicy tuna crudo was also okay. I find that the flavor of the fish used in each crudo (small appetizer on a big spoon) was a bit overwhelmed by sauce and all the onion / vegetable toppings they put on it. The ankimo pate crudo and fire tuna balls were definitely more enjoyable, even if the tuna rice balls were bit unconventional and mostly rice and spicy mayo, they were fun to eat. Toro belly nigiri quality was much better and almost melt-in-your-mouth soft, but one excellent dish out of 6 isn't enough to keep me coming back. Service was good, wait was okay, and window seats were a bit crowded but intimate and good for gazing outside on a rainy night.
author: Joy H.

description:
I went to grab lunch on a Friday with my friend. Ever since we saw the pictures of the fish taco, we knew we had to go to Domo. Our overall experience was nice. It felt very welcoming and comfortable. Maybe because it wasn't filled with customers. I was so excited that we didn't have to wait because I was starving. We were promptly greeted and seated at the bar as soon as we walked in.The waiter was very polite. 

What we ordered: 

- Fish Taco: So creative and delicious! It was refreshing yet satisfying. 

-Spicy Hulk roll: I personally love cucumber so I thought it was so good! 

- Crudos: Each order comes with two: we each got the scallop and salmon one. The salmon was good and fresh. The scallop one was very good and very fresh. I was surprised. 

- Fiesta roll: This one was good. It had mango it in. 

-Negi Hama roll: It was simple and good. 

Overall, everything was very fresh. I would definitely come back depending if there would be a wait.
author: Thatcher H.

description:
Cute, great for a rainy day. Met my mom here for lunch since it's close to work and she loves sushi.

They have great lunch options, like miso soup, salad with nigiri sushi + CA roll, which my mom got.

I got the chicken karaage and spicy tuna.

$13 for lunch specials.
author: Anoo L.

description: This sushi place is the bomb. Everything is great here. Place is small so it's perfect for a party of 2 only. Be aware that it is hard to get a spot because it fills up very fast. Amazing place and our favorite sushi spot in the city.
author: Tony S.

description:
Really don't know how I do it but it's another one of those tiny gems nestled in a lovely neighbourhood, packed to the brim with a line outside.
So I joined the queue, put my name on the list and waited to be seated. There's only one free standing table (groups bigger than 3) and the rest of the seats is lined around the window and the sushi bar.
I got a beer for the wait, had a nice chat with another lady waiting to be seated and salivated ... ;-)

Once I got a seat and had a look at the menu it got worse - I REALLY wanted to try every single item on there. Now I eat sushi a lot, but back home there's different varieties and so this was all new and exciting!

I settled for some than poke, jalapeño roll and hulk something roll. I also had some crunchy balls but forgot the name. And boy it was all good, I mean like REALLY good. If I didn't have some gagging reflex I would have gone for more. 

It's a pity I don't live here and can't have this every day. Already recommended it to a couple of friends. And rest assured I WILL be back :-D

Thanks for a lovely dinner!
author: Michael S.

description:
**This review is strictly for their takeout**

I decided to use my DoorDash credits to fulfill my sushi cravings... came across Domo and went for it. The sushi tasted really fresh and authentic - so much that I would want to check out Domo in person. And I guess it's always a bittersweet sign of reassurance when the portions are small (ie. authentically Japanese).
author: Diana K.

description: Came here around 5:30pm on a weekday and was seated immediately at the bar. The service was attentive, though the place is tiny so it would be hard to have bad service here! Sushi quality is good - not the best I've ever had, but everything was pretty solid. Typical price point for SF sushi. I recommend this place, but would find another option if there was a long wait.
author: Amy Y.

description: Cozy. Such a great food. Definitely recommend domo roll, grilled kama, and red dragon roll. I will come back!
author: Justin W.

description: San Diego Yelper here!! 2nd time here. great food. only downside... it's super small so the wait is kinda long. highly recommend. the Firecracker Balls are so tasty!
author: M M.

description:
Cute and cozy sushi place in Hayes Valley.  My sister and I were so happy we stumbled upon Domo right before it became crowded for dinner.  We grabbed a seat at the sushi bar and were able to place our order directly through the sushi chefs. Service was prompt and our food came out quickly. We tried the following three dishes:

1. *Fried Baby Octopus* (chalkboard special) - this was amazing, probably my favorite dish out of the three. Succulent baby octopus fried to a perfect crisp with some spicy mayo and micro screens scattered on the plate, what more could you ask for in an appetizer? 

2. *Fire Cracker Balls* - Loved this. A perfect blend of spicy tuna, crispiness, tobiko, sriracha, and spicy mayo. 

3. *Castro Roll* - It's nice to find a place that uses 'real' crab instead of 'imitation' crab in their rolls.  This was decent but definitely over-shadowed by our appetizers. I would probably go for something else on the menu next time. 

All-in-all a tasty meal--we plan on returning soon to try the crudos, toro, and other chalkboard specials!  Street parking is available but you will need search for it and may have to walk a few blocks. There is indoor and outdoor seating (very limited!).
author: Kristin C.

description: Had lunch at Domo today. The nigiri was excellent. I recommend the sake toro, maguro and amaebi. Great fish that is soft, fresh and flavorful.
author: Jeff M.

description:
had a pretty negative experience here. my boyfriend and I came here and put our names in and were told the wait was about 45 minutes. the hostess said she would call us when our table was ready. no worries; we were expecting a wait and grabbed a drink down the street. when we came back 45 minutes later, the hostess quoted an additional 45 minute wait. I thought it was strange, only because people coming in off the street were being given the same wait time. stupidly, we waited and then jumped when a table became available outside. 

the subsequent service was not great, although I will say the sushi is good. not change-your-life good, but it definitely checked all of the boxes. however, it was what I saw behind the counter that compelled me to write this review. I was standing in line for the bathroom and saw the chef behind the counter bend down and move the floor mat, wipe his hands on a towel, and then immediately go back to TOUCHING RAW FISH. I was so repulsed - this violates so many health codes and I was simultaneously relieved and repulsed that I had already eaten!

bottom line: subpar service, decent sushi, and a possible case of food poisoning. skip it if possible, and if you really need sushi while in hayes valley, eat at your own risk. domo management and staff, if you happen to read this, please step up the customer service and more importantly, your understanding of sanitation!
author: Amanda L.

description:
4 stars

Seating outside. Great sushis. 
hot sake. 
$$$ but worth it
can not do reservation. 
First arrived, first seated. (arrive at 6pm sharp)
author: Eve C.

description:
*Disclaimer: This review is on the service rather than the food itself.  

I anticipated to have a great experience from the reviews I've read on yelp. Unfortunately my experience proved otherwise. 

I came here on a Monday a little after 6 pm and asked to be seated for 3 people. All seats were taken and the waitress asked us to put our name on the waitlist. At this time we were the only ones on the waitlist and were suppose to be seated next. Sadly that wasn't the case! Guest of 2 people walked in without having to be on the waitlist and the waitress happily sat them down when chairs finally opened. This happened a few times, so I asked the waitress when we will be seated paraphrasing she said "well we only have 2 seats available at a time but a party of 3 should be leaving soon and we will sit you there." I thought they would be able to prioritize who came first (what's the point of a waitlist, if there not going to use it) and even though there was 2 seats available there was room to add an extra chair and although 2 separate parties of two sitting adjacent to eachother were about to close their bill, instead of keeping those seats open for us they just sat another party of 2 so of course we would never be seated at that pace. Anyway we waited 1 hour to be seated!!! (While other non-asian guests were seated under 10 mins) We were so frustrated we were going to leave!!! But we were already too hungry and have wasted our time waiting. 

The food was great, service not so much.
I felt the waitresses discriminated with prioritizing and seating their guest. I waitressed for 4 years and was an assistant manager at a restuarant before my professional career and there should be no reason guest be treated the way we did. 

Basically the food was good although on the pricey side, place is very small but good interior design, service bad, wait time bad. Cons out weigh the pros, never coming back! The food is not worth it.
author: Joy C.

description:
I took a friend here for her birthday, so we ordered a little bit of everything that other yelpers had recommended.  

We started with the Salmon Crudo which was SO good + had a lot of flavor for how small the portion was (it was served in spoons).  But at $6 for two, the crudo was a little steep.  

This was followed by the Fire Cracker Balls (6 small balls) that everyone around us had also ordered.  For $10, it was also steep, especially if you're actually trying to satiate your hunger.

The Hulk Roll came in 5 pieces and tasted like "healthy" sushi because of the cucumber sheet.   It doesn't look that flavorful, but it is!

We finished off with the Domo Roll, which tasted like your typical American-y saucy sushi roll... so I loved it.

Overall, Domo = the best fusion Japanese food I've ever had.  The seating isn't ideal for a date night, but the food is.  Small portions, lots of things to try / share that look cool, and you won't stuff your face in front of whoever you're trying to impress!

Oh we also ordered the sake... not sure which one, but it was so good!!  Sippable.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I had yesterday California rolls (you get 6). They have real crab inside and not the standard industrial sticks. Note also that this restaurant got a 100% food safety rank!
author: Alex G.

description:
DISCLAIMER: This review is solely on the service (or lack thereof) Feel free to continue reading if you're curious as to why I was unable to even try the dishes.

After reading so many positive Yelp reviews on Domo, my boyfriend and I decided to stop by one night to give it a try. We were so excited that we got there before the dinner rush and the fact that there was outdoor seating was an even bigger bonus. 
When we walked in, the waitress originally wanted to seat us indoors but we opted for the table outside because it was really stuffy inside. She was nice enough to comply and seated us at the table outside furthest from the door. 

After exploring the menu for about 10 minutes, my boyfriend and I had decided on an kobe appetizer, the crudos, and a few of their speciality rolls. Not gonna lie, we were hungry and they all sounded super delicious to us. However, after being seated for 15 minutes, I started wondering why our waitress had yet to come back and ask us for our drink order or if we had any questions about the menu. Oddly enough, we hadn't even received glasses of water. The servers were all inside so my boyfriend stood up and waved his hand inside several times to try to get their attention and let them know that we were ready. But nope, nobody paid attention to us. About 5 minutes later, we saw a waitress walk out and seat another table of two outside, closest to the entrance, who were served glasses of water after they got their menus. Weird. The server (who also happened to be our server as well) took their order shortly afterwards. We tried to flag her down but she wouldn't even look our way before she scurried back inside. Minutes later, yet another couple went in and were seated in the indoor seats facing toward us and they too received water.... Uh?

At that point I was like wtf, we've been here for 20 minutes and no one has tried to take our order or  even serve us water! I felt blatantly IGNORED. Believe me, I've worked as a server before and I know what it's like to deal with dinner rushes but after seeing two other tables receiving service after they clearly arrived after me was just inexcusable.  Not to mention, this restaurant is TINY. It's not like they couldn't see us in a crowd of only 12 diners! We gave it another 5 minutes to see if they would come around but nope. 25 minutes was enough to realize that they clearly didn't want my business. I had no choice but to just get up and leave. I'm usually not one to write one-star reviews but this horrible experience compelled me to do so. Until they step up their customer service skills, I will not be going back anytime soon.
author: Marny N.

description: Nice find...I liked that this place opens during lunch cause many Japanese restaurants I like open only during dinner.  Really liked the Domo roll and their lunch special is a pretty good deal.
author: Leland H.

description: We had the Castro rolls and the fire cracker balls. It was delicious. Highly recommended
author: Carol R.

description:
I was craving sushi and then yelped this place. Pretty good reviews for their fish taco and Domo roll, so I decided to check it out! Not bad!!! Their fish tacos are delicious! Their daily specials are written on a huge mirrored wall. Not a lot of seating, but come early and it should be fine! Parking was a little of a hassle, but definitely manageable. Food comes out one by one.. so if you're starving... patience... patience... I nearly scarfed down every single plate that came by slowly.. 

Monkfish liver pate- personally didn't eat this, but my friend says its just alright... the presentation was wonderful though, served on a soup spoon

Uni- looks delicious, didn't eat it because I'm not a fan, but according to my friend, he says it's really good! very fresh!

Fish tacos - they're not your typical fish tacos that you'd get at a taqueria or some Taco Tuesday...the plate comes with 2 "tacos".. it's a piece of albacore with a piece of salmon served on a crispy fried nori, topped with salsa and sriracha... i can't even begin to describe how all of this tastes in your mouth... sooo good! unlike anything i've ever tasted! I definitely recommend ordering this if you come here! Sadly, the whole "taco" falls apart after a few bites..

Walu (Hawaiian Butterfish) - pretty good! Don't know how else to describe this

Domo Roll - this seemed very popular on Yelp, so I decided to order this, but I wasn't really blown away. It's pretty much a California roll topped with salmon and scallop and baked.  It reminded me of a Dragon roll because I could barely taste the scallops.. 

Sweet Potato Roll - I'm super lame and had to order the non-fishy food and there's not a lot of non-seafood items here, unless you want miso soup and edamame. Don't expect bento boxes of teriyaki chicken and udon because this place serves lots of fish and sushi.. The sweet potato roll was really good! Tempura fried sweet potato wrapped in rice and seaweed and then topped with teriyaki sauce (i'm guessing?) 

California Roll - I hear the crab meat is made from real crab, so I ordered this... To be honest, I couldn't really tell the difference.. maybe it seemed to have a little more of a crabmeat like texture and maybe a little fishier. I wouldn't order this again because there's so many other things to try here!
author: Carmen C.

description:
I guess every restaurant in San Francisco is small...we had to sit outside. Note: I'm from Dallas, Texas, so I'm used to large restaurants with tons of seating. 

The fire tuna balls were amazing! Great way to start as an appetizer. I think the sushi was pretty overpriced, but unique and tasty. There wasn't rice in many of the rolls, which i thought was a staple part of sushi. 

Good food, I'm just being cheap!
author: Jim G.

description:
Amazing fusion Japanese! Yes, it's probably not the most "authentic" Japanese sushi and you may find better ones in more Japanese area. But this is a very unique and sincere fusion Japanese shop. Unique dishes and combinations, excellent balance in taste and texture, ie the fish taco and spicy hulk. Also tried the Saba Hit who has hints of plum flavor in it. 
It is unfortunate that the store is so small and the wait can be as long as an hour on a Friday night at 9pm. That's the only reason for the minus one star. 
Will definitely go back, maybe get some happy hour snacks before heading over there at 8pm next time!
author: Angela Y.

description:
tl;dr Get the Domo roll. 

Review: Domo is the reason I left my Toronto life behind me and moved to SF. It totally sold me on the SF foodie lifestyle, and captured it succinctly in a single dining session. I discovered Domo through a random person tweeting at me that I try it out while visiting SF ~6 years ago (when I actually used to tweet). It's been my favourite sushi place on this planet ever since. Their Domo roll is a must try. Your mouth will explode (not literally, unless you have some bizarre allergy). It's so good that even my toddlers love it! Baby's first word was "sushi". Or was it?
So if you're wondering if you should move to SF, get the Domo roll and you'll be  booking that U-Haul truck in no time.
author: Dejana B.

description: Barely edible sushi. Everything was sickly sweet and tasted like it was smothered in high fructose corn syrup. I've had a headache all day from it. And the fish was ready for the garbage can.
author: Eater S.

description: I am not sure why this place has more than two stars. This place had the worst service I have experienced in a very long time. I arrived a little past 6 pm along with two other people. We waited at least 45 minutes to almost an hour just to be seated. There were more than 7 people they seated before us, who JUST CAME without even having to wait or put their name on the waitlist board. I am waitress myself and the way we were treated here was completely appalling. Though the food was very tasty, the price was more on the expensive side, and for the service, the price was NOT WORTH IT as they were completely unprofessional. I do not recommend this place to anyone. If you are looking for great service, look elsewhere as you will end up wasting your time and money.
author: Maliyah B.

description:
Horrible service! We waited for one hour and never got a table. We had to leave. Older waiter was a complete douche. Never again.

Went again - food great better service this time
author: Ron C.

description:
Surprising and creative combinations with super fresh fish!

Fire cracker balls lived up to their name!
Domo roll was over the top and deliciously so
Dragon roll was well executed
Fish tacos was a super fresh interpretation, with a seaweed "shell"
author: Kathryn C.

description: YAYYY for delicious sushi! I recently moved to North Carolina, and as much as I like parts of it, one of things they lack is yummy SUSHI!!! Domo is small like many sushi spots, but I enjoyed the intimate atmosphere. My friend and I had a 20 minute wait on a rainy, cold Sunday night around 7pm. The green tea was flavorful and perfect on a cold night. We split the Fire Tuna Balls, Old School Negi Hama, and Salmon Citron. As delicious as the Fire Tuna Balls were, I personally enjoyed the other 2 rolls the best because they were simpler and showcased the fresh hamachi and salmon. AHHH fresh fish in sushi how I've MISSED YOU!!! With Domo in the thick of Hayes Valley, it's also close to plenty of post-dinner drinks or dessert spots. Domo is def a win in my Yelp book!
author: Diane G.

description: Sushi is bomb. Great for date night with cafe & art across the street for drinks before or after!
author: Tori W.

description:
Small restaurant with very good fresh sushi.  We ordered a couple of appetizers, sashimi, and some sushi specials which were the bomb.  The domo roll was a disappointment (too heavy and over sauced)  Stick with the raw fish and you'll love it.

Service could be more down to earth.  But the sushi chef was friendly.
author: Amihan M.

description: My go to local sushi place. I went with my roommate one weekday night around 6pm and it was only us and another duo there. By the time we left it was almost full, but I've seen the place get packed, especially weekend nights. Highly recommend fire cracker balls.
author: Shawn T.

description:
One of my favorite local sushi places in the city. Consistently fresh fish, imaginative rolls and a constantly changing interesting board of specials. The restaurant itself is small, crowded, hip and fun with a constant buzz - service can be spotty but that's only because the excellent servers are always rushed off their feet. 

I'll often get take out from Domo and food is always ready quickly and on time, and every time you pick up servers treat you with the same importance and politeness that you'd expect as a diner walking in with a reservation (a rarity in SF).
author: Sam E.

description: I was recommended here by a friend. Never had such terrible service in any restauraunt. The hostess and waitress were incredibly rude and ruined the meal. The wait is incredibly long to get in, and for all that wait you get treated like garbage as a result. If you like paying a lot of money for mediocre food and terrible service, this is your place. Otherwise, I highly recommend avoiding it.
author: Bill P.

description:
amazing for their food and amazing prices! I would eat there everyday if parking wasn't an issue.

YUMMY!
author: Emily L.

description:
Domo-Arigatou Gozaimasu!

Love this place! Was in the area on a Friday night having tea at Samovar and decided to stroll around the area to look for sushi. Only a block and a half away.. DOMO! Wrote my name down for two, took a brisk walk around Hayes and was called when we arrived back.

Cozy, well-designed sushi bar with DELICIOUS rolls. Only bar chairs along the sushi bar and walls of the place, one table inside, and a few tables for four outside. 

The service was excellent, the food came out in a timely manner and I will forever remember the kobe roll and firecracker ball. They do work on their Sexy Mama roll (avacado and asparagus topped with salmon and lemon slice) as well - which is my all-time fave classic roll!!

drrrooool. Think I'll go back this weekend.
author: Erin C.

description: Fish tacos!! Crispy, flavorful fish tacos! I never had anything like it. We were able to enjoy our large beers while waiting to be seated. The place is pretty small but such an intimate setting. Fresh fish and great flavors. Will definitely be back!
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
This place was really good. The nigiri selection was pretty good, meaning they actually had interesting selections! and most importantly it was super fresh! 

I guess the one thing that kind of sucks but not enough to bring it to four stars.. is the wait. But who cares just go and have a drink at noir around the corner and once they call you can go back and enjoy good sushi! 

Sante!
author: Gilmar A.

description:
Some of the best sushi I've ever had. It's a little bit out if the way for me but it's worth the journey. 

I initially just ordered the firecracker balls, which was out of this world. They were fresh and infused with so much flavor. I didn't even put a lot of soy sauce on it (like I usually do) because I wanted to really taste what I was eating. 

Even though I was full, I couldn't resist ordering the crispy California roll which took me over the edge. I devoured that roll so fast! 

The restaurant is very small and intimate so don't go with a large group. Be prepared to wait a while for a seat, but once you are seated the service is fast and attentive.
author: Abena O.

description: Great sushi. Very fresh and tasty. The place is very small but overall a good atmosphere and still comfortable. I think it took about 30 minutes for us to get seated. Highly recommend it :)
author: Sandra S.

description:
Domo. The first thing that pops in my head when I hear Domo is Bubzbeauty's puppy, the small brown furry sucker.

Besides the point, my friend wanted to go to Eiji. Sad to say, they decided to take a summer vacation this week and we were in tears, sitting on the curb, wondering how it would have been if we had a taste of the sweet sweet dango.

She had another place already in mind, Domo. Only problem was that it was pretty far from where we were, in terms of walking. Decided to drive there and was seated promptly during prime lunch time. Note, this place isn't the usual chair-and-table restaurant; every seat was a bar seat, and lucky for me and my friend and her boyfriend, we managed to nab three window bar seats.

Since I didn't have unagi in ages, I immediately decided on the Open Face Dragon, Who can say no to the combination of freshwater eel, tempera shrimp AND avocado over rice? My friends decided to share an order of the Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke.

Both options were pretty good; Open Face Dragon was plated with a elegant design that you would probably see in a 5-star place. I was considered that the place was going to give me a straight up bento box with all of these things in its compartments; I am pleased for the fact that Domo decided to elevate something that seems so basic.

My friend did mention that she was concern about taking me here, since she never had tried it and that it was catered more towards the American crowd, not the old-fashion hole-in-the-wall Japanese ryouri that I can get back home in Little Tokyo. Lucky for me, that thought disappeared as soon as she took her first bite of her own food.

A place to get a nice meal, if you don't mind shelling out a few extra dollars.
author: Tom T.

description:
I had a cold, but I really really wanted to try this while I was in town. What did the food taste like? Not entirely sure, as I was only able to pick up flavors intermittently. Boyfriend enjoyed the Wiki Wiki roll, and we also got seaweed salad, sake sashimi and...I got another neat roll. Whoops.

Anyhow, the wait wasn't too bad. It's just REALLY awkward if you wait outside since they have a row of seats that faces the sidewalk (and therefore if you are waiting, you're taunted by people who have food and drinks.) Really cramped - I think if you are a bulky person you may be a tad uncomfortable as the seating is really tight.

Staff was nice enough. If you sit right in front of the bar you can see them making food which is fun.
author: Biscuit B.

description:
Domo arigato!

Domo has indefinitely claimed the rights to my favorite place to find fresh fish and creative rolls. We ordered "omakase" (chef's choice) and this is why we got to try a little bit of everything that makes Domo so special.

The Spicy Hulk - with spicy tuna, avo, and ponzu wrapped up in cucumber. This is a nice change from the heavy rice in most rolls. The texture is an interesting element and the plate a beautiful piece of art. 

The Kobe Beef roll with asparagus, ginger, avacado, ponzu was also an interesting flavor/texture. The Fish Taco, nori tempura fried with fresh sashimi and homemade pepper salsa - delicious! A must order.

It seems that Domo does really well creatively. Both the design of the dish and the presentation are flawless. Its easy to bring friends here and be assured that everyone will find something they enjoy.

but....fresh fish- Thats what I really come to places like this for. I want sashimi, I want nigiri. Omakase gifted our taste-buds with so many cuts of beautifully colored fish. *happy happy girl* The Sunazuri (hamachi belly) is my favorite.
author: Jocelyn B.

description: My husband and I came here for dinner before heading to the ballet - we arrived around 6 on a weekday night and sat right down. We ordered 2 giant bottles of sapporo, a carafe of sake, fish tacos, california roll, and salmon/yellowtail/seared tuna/snow crab nigiri. It all cost less than $75 and we were stuffed. All fresh, all delicious and our server was attentive. Plus the ambiance was cute. What more could you want?!
author: Megan V.

description:
I went here last week for dinner with my sister in law. This was my very first time going to domo. I thought their sushi was very good. Specially their "Fish tacos"
If you visit this place this is something you must try! I gotta say, their service was a bit slow. But over all it was great going here.
author: Berlin M.

description:
Ate here after reading all the reviews and I was pretty disappointed. I forgot most of the rolls we ordered but for 50 dollars, the amount was tiny and I found nothing remarkable about the rolls to write home about. Me and the lady started off with that to test the waters and decided it was enough. We left hungry and ate at Chez Maman after that 50 dollar appetizer. 

So many better sushi spots around worth the value and quality so I really don't see what people find great about this place. Service was good and nothing to complain about there. I left thinking that these reviews have failed me again. Overhyped. Disappointed.

Oh, and this is not a legitimate Japanese restaurant. The entire staff is practically Hispanic, nothing wrong with that but they're not well trained sushi chefs either. The sushi rice on the nigiri was hard and had no flavor. Fish to rice ratio was terribly off. I tried to remove the fish on top to dip it in soy sauce and they packed it so tight it was practically glued to the rice. Tsk.
author: Hiroki M.

description: Great sushi! Come right as they open because it's a really small place and seating and service might be compromised once they get busy.
author: Patrick H.

description:
They don't take reservations so make sure to put your name on the waiting list! This place is tiny but we hardly waited at all. We just sat at one of their tables outside and as soon as my date went back in to check how much longer it would be, we were up! We were seated at the window bar area which was surprisingly not too bad since I usually hate sitting side by side with people. It's super weird not facing someone while talking!  

Our sashimi came a good half hour after everything else had arrived. I asked the waiter and he came back and said they had a huge order so ours was coming shortly. Something tells me he just forgot to put in our sashimi order but he did offer some apology dessert! My date and I both got sesame ice cream which was 10x better than the ice cream we got at Smitten after (yeah I know, ice cream overkill). 

Oh and theres a park right by the restaurant so we played on the giant jungle gym and checked out the super trippy art installation to work off all the calories we just had weeeeeee. 

p.s. climbing up a jungle gym is not as easy as getting back down.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Best sushi experience that I can recall - tacos, fireball, red dragon, rice beer! Coming back regularly ;)
author: Caroline L.

description:
This started out as a TWO star review but it went back up! Hear me out...

Came here last night, for the first time, at 7pm. Long line (no problem), waited about an hour, while we scouted the menu and specials on the mirror so we knew exactly what to order when ready. Then sadness arrived...all I heard was the waiter saying "don't hate me, you're gonna hate me" because "we are out of Uni, Ankimo, Amaebi, etc..." The sudden rush of I wanna leave right now flashes before my eyes...but we decided to give it a chance. Ok, the food is YUM YUM and the presentation is gorge so what can I say. They gave us the "we just re-opened after ten days of vacation"...we softy!

We ordered almost everything else other than our favorites (above). Walu, Hamachi, Albacore, Saba (THE FRESHEST and luved the fried fish head/bone presentation), Spicy Hulk (Yummmmy cucumber/tuna), Sexy Mama (my fav of the hour), Wagyu beef roll, and the hamachi/tuna/avacado tacos. SUUUPERB!
author: Vee V.

description:
Domo has become my go-to sushi spot in San Francisco as long as I'm in a small group. While it's small, and it can sometimes take some time to be seated, it's always worth the wait! Service once you're seated is fast and friendly.

There's an excellent selection on the regular menu ranging from traditional sushi dishes to more 'fusion' food, and the specials board always has something interesting and seasonal. Try the wonderful take on fish tacos, or the firecracker balls.
author: Sam E.

description:
I went to an early dinner at Domo on a Wednesday night and it was great for a quiet dinner on a weeknight after work. The area is really cute, lots of bars and restaurants. 

Ambiance: Casual, relaxed. Small restaurant with bar style seating, a few small tables inside, and 3 round tables outside. 

Food: Fresh and delicious. We ordered the Spicy Tuna Roll, Jalapeno Hamachi, Fire Cracker Balls, and miso soup. 

Spicy Tuna Roll: Really good and actually spicy. The fish was very fresh and seasoned well. 

Jalapeno Hamachi: I wish the Sea Salt and Jalapeno had more flavor. I really wanted to like this roll but I don't think it had the kick I was looking for. 

Fire Cracker Balls: So TASTY! You should definitely get these. They are crispy on the outside with spicy mayo and unagi sauce on top. 


All in all, the menu is creative and food fresh so I definitely want to go back and try some of their other items.
author: Maliha Z.

description:
Came in with my girlfriend on a Monday night at the end of a long weekend. Domo is tiny - it seats maybe 20 people - and it was full when we arrived. We put our names on the list and settled in for a wait. The sushi gods were smiling on us because a few minutes later, the entire restaurant paid their checks simultaneously and left. We sat at the outward-facing counter with a lovely view of the cute block Domo inhabits.

We started with edamame. It was lightly dusted with salt: perfect. We had snow crab (from the specials menu) and unagi nigiri, both of which were fresh and flavorful. We continued with the Alpha roll which adds mango to the usual combination of fish and accoutrements for a fun twist. We also had the Fire Cracker Balls which are absolutely not to be missed. They are a refreshing take on the overplayed fried maki motif. We also snagged some negi toro (also from the specials menu) maki which was fatty and delicious. The only food I didn't love was the fish tacos - too many flavors and textures competing with each other.

The service was attentive but there was a serious lull between our first round of food and the rest of it. Would have been nice to have our food a little more evenly spaced out. Obviously though that's a nit pick because I had to find something to criticize.

Can't wait to make it back. Definitely my new go-to sushi in SF.
author: Adam R.

description: Domo is all about sushi, with not much else to the menu besides rolls and nigiri. However, everything they put out is great and the quality of the fish is good as well. My favorite roll is the Castro roll because of its simplicity and the huge pieces of raw fish on top. The California roll base is made with real crab, and the generous slices of sashimi make for a huge roll. The Alpha roll is also a great pick, with tuna on top along with mango and jalapeño that makes the flavor pop. For something a little heavier, the Dragon roll or the Domo roll are saucier and heavier. The Domo in particular, is baked and has a little more sauce on top, but I appreciated that it wasn't drowning in heavy flavors like baked rolls in a lot of other sushi places. The scallop on top was also a nice refreshing touch. Domo is definitely one of my new go-to spots to satisfy my sushi fix!
author: Ashley T.

description: Rude. Food pretty good (though the fish tacos were not fresh). But the service? I was standing up and literally writing out the tip on the receipt when the waiter told me to move because someone else wanted the table. The new customers were apologetic and fine with waiting 30 seconds while I calculated the tip. Needless to say, the guy lost most of his tip by not waiting 30 seconds.
author: Isobel W.

description:
I'm truly a sucker for good music playing in the background, and Domo definitely gets it right.  There's something about the mix of jazz and sushi, and of R&B/hip-hip and sushi that really works. Domo to me is the less pretentious, more casual brother to Yoshi's, without live music, and in a cozier home.

Aside from the ambience, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The folks delivering our food placed the plates on our table with little jokes and spritely remarks. 

The food itself was delectable.  While pricey, I'd say the food is well worth it. 

Here's the run-down of what we divulged in:
Hawaiian Style Tuna Poke - delicious, nice flavors, but not groundbreaking in terms of innovative flavors, yet still worth the price.
Small crudos, spicy tuna and scallop - once again delicious: tuna tasted fresh, seasoning was good, but I particularly enjoyed the scallop.
Fire Cracker Balls - Yelp tips told us to get it. The Fire Cracker Balls were indeed crackin'.
Domo Roll - I'm not a fan of the Lion King roll to begin with, but this roll changed my mind for the night.
Kobe Beef - as an unusual item, we obviously had to try this. Verdict: The beef was well seasoned, and the roll itself was rich and creamy (because of the avocado). Overall, I'd re-order, yes.
Mac Daddy - daddy got it right. delicious.

Thanks for the meal, Domo.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
Fire Cracker Balls. I mean, with a name like that how could you go wrong? Crunchy, spicy bits of goodness that burst in your mouth (thanks to the roe on top). It's, quite literally, a flavor explosion-osion-osion-osion (echo fade)! Spicy tuna rolled up, breaded and deep fried topped with a variety of sauces, scallions and roe. So spicy. So good. I almost regret getting them because I know I'll end up craving them and will be unsatisfied as they are only available across the country. Sad face.

Domo is a teeny tiny little sushi joint not far from my magical wonderland Miette. I stumbled upon it while wandering around and, after a week long binge on super rich foods, I decided sushi might make a good, light dinner. Of course I order the deep fried roll but that's neither here nor there. The point is, this place was good. 

It's got mega limited eating. I was exploring solo so I was able to grab a seat at the bar quickly as there was one lone chair available. The wait wasn't huge but there were a handful of folks milling about at the door waiting for spots to open up. 

I was having a severe case of my eyes are bigger than my stomach. Everything on the menu looked so good. I wanted to try 2 appetizers and a crap ton of rolls but I limited myself to some edemame (decent--I'm not sure how edemame can be kind of subpar but this one was. There was just something a bit different to me in terms of the flavor) and a couple of rolls--the firecracker balls and the domo roll. Still too much but oh so good.

The firecracker balls were my favorite, as I mentioned, but the domo roll was a close second. A california roll wrapped in cooked salmon and seared scallops topped with spicy mayo and a few other sauces. Oh good lord those scallops were good. I wish there had been more of them (it was more salmon heavy). Although delicious it was difficult to eat. I think the scallops made it a bit hard to roll so the pieces fell apart. Huge sushi pet peeve of mine but it was damn tasty I let it slide. SLIDE RIGHT INTO MY BELLY, THAT IS.

The service is quick but not overly friendly. The sushi chefs were right in front of me but barely glanced in our direction. Focus! There were only a couple of waitstaff around and I saw them doing things like preparing the edemame and other small apps. They do a lot more than just taking your order and bringing your plates! The kitchen is visible and super teeny tiny. Like, studio kitchen small. It's amazing that they churn out so many delicious hot dishes (like the FCB) with a space as small as that. Impressive!

The prices for the special rolls are a little up there but worth it if you like sushi. Ugh, writing this review had be reliving the experience in my brain and now I'm all sad face because I'm missing those scallops and hot little nuggets. Boohoohoo. Damn you Domo for being so darn good.
author: Annette J.

description:
My fiance and I love sushi/Japanese and wanted to try something new and different. Were we disappointed.

First off, this place is TINY. Definitely be prepared to wait a long time. Plus there's really no indoor wait area, so it's best to walk around during your wait. It would be awful to try to come here on a stormy day.

The decor inside is very chic and trendy, which I really like. Service was friendly once we were seated. Everything was great up to this point (minus the long wait).

Onto the food. Everything has an interestingly unauthentic, fusion taste, which may or may not tickle your taste buds. For us, we just found the flavor profiles on the rolls we tried a little foreign (we are used to eating traditional sushi/ sashimi - think Sushi Sam's in San Mateo, Ariake in SF). The only thing we both thoroughly enjoyed was the special fish taco dish. THAT was really tasty, but unfortunately wasn't enough to save the rest of the dining experience. 

It was fun trekking to this place and doing something different. But sadly, I won't be back.
author: Jing D.

description: I went there a bunch of time and probably spent over 1000 in the past year with my friends. Last experience was crappy, I ordered take out and waited extra hour outside like a looser. Came in 4 times to ask what's up with my order and they said I'm not the only one waiting, even though I came 5 min after they told me to show up for the pick up. Sushi is good but I wish staff was a bit friendlier especially to frequent customers
author: Bob M.

description:
Pros: hip, delicious, clean, friendly staff
Cons: a bit of a lag between sushi, the fish tacos

I went here with my boyfriend on Monday of a long holiday weekend. Super short wait by SF standards. The host was super attentive and made us feel like he was really into getting us a spot. We ordered snow crab and unagi nigiri, the fish tacos, edamame, the alpha roll, and the fire balls. All except the fish tacos were amazing. The alpha roll was a fast favorite. The fire balls were so good we could have ordered another, and the nigiri was fresh and light. The fish tacos were just not my thing. They were raw kind of watery fish on tempura fried seaweed with tomato relish. I could see how people would like them, but to me they were meh.

Overall, this beats Ryoko's and most other sushi I have had in SF, but it isn't LA's Katsu-ya status of amaze balls. Will definitely make it my go-to sushi place for easy, fresh dinner.
author: Laura W.

description: I showed up at Domo on a busy friday night, knowing full well I wouldn't be able to get a seat, especially as a party of one. I didn't realize just how small the restaurant is, with only bar seating, and a couple small tables outside. So I decided to place an order to go, and the staff was super friendly. They helped me get my food quickly so I could take it home and try it. The Domo Roll and Fire Tuna balls were both fantastic! I'd rank them in my Top 5 favorite sushi places (and I'm a fan of the americanized sushi style). I only wish the place was bigger, but it would be nice to come back and grab one of those outside seats!
author: Jennifer M.

description: The sushi was delicious. Had to order second rounds of Alpha roll, Castro and Domo. Will come back!! This place is tiny though so not suitable for groups.
author: Suna L.

description:
I have been coming here for almost 3 years now. I used to think it was pricey when I first moved to SF but when I got situated, I realized this place is a steal compared to a lot of other sushi spots. For the quality I haven't found a better value. Chef's choice sashimi all the way with a alpha roll or onkimo to follow it up. If you have never had the fish tacos try them. They are not regular fish tacos and are awesome. Fried nori with two pieces of fish, salsa and shiracha.  Super good. I could go on and on but i won't. 

It's a small place and doesn't take reservations so don't come in expecting a table within 30 minutes or even an hour with your group of 5 or anything like that. Pro tip: dine solo or come with 2 OR 3 more people nothing else. 2 person spots get taken up fast (Dates) so come early if that's you. Otherwise the solo spot will get the bar and the triple or quad group will get the only actual table in the place. 

Things have changed a bit since I first stumbled in here but the staff is super friendly and the food is still good. Be nice and you will be treated nice as well
author: Greg G.

description:
This place always has a wait, and unlike alot of places in SF, its worth it!
Good specials, good quality of fish, cool little spot with good sushi, some might find it expensive but at least you get good quality for the money, its my girls favorite spot so we go here semi-regularly, we love you domo!
author: Drew V.

description:
I pretty much tried everything on their Nigiri list and it was phenomenal. Luckily, we got seating at the bar within 5 minutes of arrival, and dove right in. 
This is my kind of restaurant: not pretentious and great food.
I'm a regular now.
author: Dhruv L.

description: Domo is great - it toes the line b/w traditional sushi and Americanized sushi, which I'm all for! Their sushi and sashimi is fresh and delicious. If you're looking for something fun and YUMMY get the fish "tacos." They're open-faced on fried nori and so, so good. It's a tiny spot right in Hayes Valley, which is lovely and nice (despite being so close to Civic Center/SoMa/Tenderloin).
author: Crystal M.

description:
Great food. We tried a bunch of different stuff. the squid karaage was a nice twist from the usual chicken karaage. All the rolls we had were great. 

I wonder how bad the wait can get though since it is a tiny spot. THere's only one table and the rest is bar seating. We went on a monday night and waited 30 minutes.
author: Ricky F.

description: I've always enjoyed this place but the food quality has gone down hill significantly since the last time I was there. The spicy tuna balls are no longer fried balls but a baked roll that comes sliced. Different texture completely. My salad was warm and wilted and parts of my lettuce was rotten.  Too many short cuts are being taken on the food which makes me nervous when it comes to sushi.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
OK not as good as SushiZone but definitely more variety and more seating. As for the fish, its fresh, abundant and lots of off menus specials for you 'picky/snooty' eaters.

Best: monkfish liver and uni app, fireballs, lunch specials and special fish of the day
Not so Best: smelly sewer in front, only one 4 top and parking
author: Jai D.

description:
My review has been removed again and again.

100% Chinese.
No offense but I don't think they do sushi right. There is no guarantee that they can get a good fish. May be from Chinatown. I can not trust them for raw fish.

When I saw the baseball cap assistant got a large tube of QP- mayonnaise out and squeezed right on a Jive Ass Roll, that gross me out, and I said,
"This is it! I won't be back here again."
Mayonnaise and Raw-fish won't go together.

So, I'll recommend the place to Non-Japo people, who easily misread and manipulate by imitators.
So I say,
What kind of sushi do I mean and what kind of sushi do we seek? Not a Pax Asians enforced on the world by American fish of sushi, not the sushi of the grave or the security of the old fish.
