description: A fun and friendly place featuring excellent fresh sushi with a few twists--such as the excellent little spoons of crudo and the delightful take on fish tacos.
author: David T.

description: Strolled in here for a late lunch one Monday after noticing they were open.  It actually wasn't our first choice, but a lot of other places in the neighborhood are closed Mondays apparently.  In any case, when we walked in there was only one other person there, and she was waiting for takeout.  The whole place maybe only seats about twenty.  We took a couple seats at the sushi bar and perused the menu and specials board.  For a small place, the menu did have a lot of variety.  The sushi chef was cutting up salmon and doing prep work for the evening when we came in, and everything looked very fresh.  They even have real crab California Rolls.  Kampachi Carpaccio was delicious, as was my Negi Hamachi Handroll.  I can't remember everything else we had, but I had a fun little conversation with him about Uni, which is a recent development for me.  A friend convinced me to try it in Los Angeles and now I love it.  The chef's comment: "Welcome to the other side."
author: Lindsay B.

description: The sushi here is strictly "typical" sushi, which is to say your usual array of rolls and nigiri.  The atmosphere is decent, but almost strictly counter based seating, so it's not great for groups.  The fish isn't as good as Sebo, nor is the vibe, but if you're looking for a cozy, reasonably priced, tasty neighborhood sushi spot, this one is certainly decent.
author: Patrick P.

description: okay, this place is pretty good, but not to die for. i love sushi and love the location and love the atmosphere, so will definitely go back. but some of their rolls needed some help. any salmon nigiri, sashimi, or roll was spectacular, so tasty. there are some better sushi places out there, but since this place feels very local and is small, i will definitely go back.
author: Bowen P.

description: One word: DELICIOUS! Salmon skin hand roll - amazing. California Crunchy roll - out of this world. Everything is fresh, delicious, and pretty affordable. Great ambiance!! Went there twice in the last week.
author: Monica S.

description: Based on all the good comments here, the wife and I checked out Domo last night and had an absolutely superb meal.     Flavor, texture, temperature variations and subtlety with each dish.    Fresh and delicious.   Friendly and efficient staff.     Highly recommended by a couple of sushi snobs.
author: Sean V.

description: Had lunch here on their first day and have to say it is the freshest most tastiest sashimi I have experienced in SF.  Domo is a no nonsense quality restaurant and will definitely be a favorite hang out of mine and a very nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Michael C.

description: I really love Domo. It's super small, but i've never had a problem getting a table. The sushi is really creative and really good and not super expensive. The place is spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. And the guys behind the bar are super cool, you feel really welcome when you step inside their little sushi sanctuary. Doesn't get much better than Domo.
author: Troy H.

description: Feh. Not impressed. The fish didn't taste super fresh, and the rolls weren't made tightly enough, so they all fell apart.
author: Sarah Y.

description: Your typical sushi bar, nothing special, nice neighborhood place.
author: David S.

description: Domo is a great addition to the neighborhood.  I ate/drank there tonight with my wife, and it was a wonderful experience.  Kuo and company, welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Greg L.

description:
mixed on this place.  it just opened up so i assume some kinks are being worked out.

i started with the edamame, and honestly it was prob the worst i have ever had in my life (and i have had a lot of edamame).   very cold, not salted, and slimy a bit with the inner casing falling apart.

asparagus and cucumber rolls were v. good.  the yellowtail with jalapeno was very good, but i am not sure if that day they made a pepper mistake or what.  i LOVE spicy food, but whatever pepper they put in was wayyyy too spicy for the fish.  

an issue that cannot be fixed is the size and layout of the place.  i am not a big person, and my food and myself took up two places (i came at lunch).  on a crowded night, dining with another person in the space of only two would be a v. tight squeeze.  it is all bar seating, only one table.  

last small thing....$20 credit card min.  i have no prob with a min, but the lunch specials advertised are way under $20, or if you are having lunch alone the bill would likely be under $20.  i asked, and no budging on this one, so i had to run to the atm before eating (since my bill was under $20).
author: n. h.

description: good stuff! they have a lot of wacky california-style rolls and other things, lots of their own deep-fried creations. cheap thrills with tons of sweet sauces. relatively cheap, decent-quality fish. okay service. food was super quick to arrive.
author: Wangston P.

description: Domo is good, but not great. The price isn't exactly cheap and the menu isn't big. I mainly went because my friend is a sushi fan and after looking around online, Domo was one of the better rated ones. I don't eat raw fish so I was looking around to see what was available and it seemed like that only the California Rolls, Ebi (shrimp) Tempura, and Ebi Nagiri is cooked, everything else was raw that I could tell. The place is also very small, just to give you an idea how small, the picture that was taken with people sitting at the counter looking out the window, there's about an opposite side to it where the bar is at and 3 tables, one on the inside and two outside and that's it. By the time me and my friend left, there were two big parties waiting which I can't say that was a good idea since seating is limited already as is. Also, sitting at the counter is with stools, which isn't too bad except that it's so crowded that it's difficult to get your stool closer to the counter. I would recommend this place if you're a sushi fan and looking for some place new to try for yourself, otherwise, I might avoid it, even more so if it's out of your way.
author: Richard C.
